title: I'm 110% done with the Bronze Shaming.
body:
Edit:  I encourage you to read this entire post before you just tell me to "git gud scrub"

So I just got done with a game where the top laner and ADC pretty much just nitpicked me to death about me being Bronze.  They did not hesistate to tell me that I made over 500 mistakes in that game (yet they failed to specify what they were, primarily because they weren't focused on making me a better player).  I think what really set me off and made me write about this was in the middle of the game (them nitpicking me started from the beginning when they checked my ELO with NAOPGG and figured out I was Bronze I).

What happened that set me over the edge was when it was mid game and the enemy Lee Sin was coming bot lane with Yasuo against the top laner and ADC.  I pinged them to be careful because there was no vision of them outside of them, and generally 2v4s against a tank, two burst assassins, and an ADC that deals true damage generally means that you're fucked if you don't know it's coming.  The response I got?  Not "thank you" not "Soraka you saved our asses" it was "don't you ping us you bronzie."

Yes, you heard that right.  I got flamed for being a good team player.  Solely because I was Bronze.  To really add insult to injury, you know what my score was endgame?  4/0/17.  I didn't feed, I didn't steal any kills from the ADC (despite him being the primary one that was flaming me all game), and I fucking picked a support that synergized well with the carry because I wanted to be a good team player.  Yeah, we stomped that game, and yeah, I considered that S+ rank I acquired at the end of the game properly deserved (unlike the one I got from that game where the enemy carry intentionally fed), but this game wasn't one of the best I played.  It was one of the worst because two assholes thought that just because they were platinum that they were allowed to flame me all game for every little mistake I made.  Forgive me for not playing this game perfectly 24/7.  Don't you think if I played this game perfectly, I'd know it by now, and would be picketing outside of TSM asking why they're looking for supports in SK when the best one's right here?  (HEAVY SARCASM OBVIOUSLY)

I quite frankly don't know what's worse.  Having to deal with the toxicity, feeding, and AFKing in ranked at my ELO trying to climb, or having to deal with "well, all Bronzies are fat ans stupid HEU HA HA, HOH HOH, SNORT, HO HO, WERP WERP WERP WERP WERP" in normals.

replies.body:
That's not them shaming you for being bronze, that's them shaming you because they're elitist assholes.

You get this kind of behavior at all levels of play.  The plat 5 player will trash talk the silver 1 in his game.  The Gold 5 player will trash talk the silver 3 player in his game.  

Being bronze obviously carries a negative perception, but in general it just boils down to people who are insecure about themselves and feel a need to lord their perceived superiority over others.  Those people are empty inside, they're trying to justify themselves by saying they're better at something than you purely because of a ranking (which may or may not even be true).  It's best to just ignore them.  And honestly making this thread isn't going to help the cause, and if they saw it they would probably appreciate that they made you upset because that's just the type of people they are.

Report and move on with your life imo.  If it gets out of hand I'll mute people, though I try to stay away from that when I can.
This is why I stay unranked. Telling people to get on my undefined level shuts them up quick.
I love you
i love it when people say get on my level, and then i reply with ew no i don't want to be bronze

It's pretty funny, actually.  Your MMRs have to be pretty similar, which either means you play much better than someone in Bronze and they shouldn't be insulting you, or they have been playing so badly recently they're getting matched with bronze players.

Considering your score, you're much better than a bronze player.

To play Devil's Advocate, that's not what I normally go when I play a game.  That was definitely an example of one of my "better games."  Very rarely am I capable of pulling off that kind of awesomeness with a squishy champ like Soraka.

That being said, I know my shit.  I think the main thing holding me back from climbing (outside of the nonsense of Yolo Queue's system and matchmaking) is mechanical skill and micromanagement.  Theorycrafting and putting together a well synergized team are my strong suits.

This game has micromanagement? 

Hey, good on ya for recognizing your faults, though, that's the first step to improvement! :D My problem has always been decision-making and prioritizing. Not objectives, but when to farm and when not to farm, that kind of thing. Sometimes I farm too much and my team suffers for me, or I farm too little and I suffer for them. People can give general guidelines, but that tends to melt away when the actual game starts and none of their proposed guideline criterion are met. Mechanics are less of a problem for me personally, but obviously still there since I'm not "uber god status" or anything like that. 

Hmm... now I wanna play Vayne or something and improve my mechanics and positioning. Just reading this type of post, one that admits faults, makes me think about mine and want to improve them. So, uh, thanks by proxy!

Last season I was gold 5, which is nice and all, but I find it hilarious when my ELO puts me up against golds and plats because they expect me to be terrible at the game. Then I kick their asses because they underestimate me. They might have played differently if I were on the same ranking as them, sure, but I never cease to find this hilarious in normals. I do not think that all higher ranking players are elitist pricks, but I do think that underestimating ones opponent is the most bronze thing a player can do besides falling for the "press D to dance" trick. Yeah, I might be a troll for doing this, but I'm the troll bronze 3 that made a gold or better look like an asshole, and for that I am truly happy I play league of legends.

The flip-side of this is being Diamond in solo ranked queue, and then wanting to goof off in a normal queue game or try out a new champion for the first time and getting flamed with "lol how are you diamond" and "how much did you buy your account for".

Even when you explain to them "it's a normal queue", "trying out a new champ, sorry", or "i'm not tryharding for this", it's always "lol tell me again how much to buy account" and "you're reported". 

All levels of play get picked on by assholes, and those assholes exist in all levels of play.

Hey, thought I'd drop two cents on the topic, probably from a different perspective since I'm in the higher portion of elos.

While Bronze shaming is definitely a thing, it isn't the right thing to do. It's bullying and it's just rude.

On the other side of the coin, however, it's also warranted in some cases.

Say we were in argument (not that I want to argue with you, you seem like a great guy,) and we didn't get along with each other about one aspect of the game. I feel like I'm ENTITLED to being able to say "I know more than you do," and instantly be right. It doesn't mean I will, because personally I'd argue intelligently and make a case for my argument, but there is a sense of entitlement in some cases nonetheless.

However, in the situation you described, it was wrong of them to harass you for something OUT OF YOUR CONTROL, in which case I'm pretty sure is report worthy.

Make no mistake, making fun of someone else's rank is wrong, but hear me out when I say that there is entitlement in one way or another when it comes to two different elos.

I don't think instantly being right just because you're in a high elo, is accurate. I've been here for years and know more than many higher elo players I have met/played with. Application has more to do with it than knowing more. I know how Akali is played but can't execute her for shit.

I'm not saying I would automatically win an argument JUST because I'm a higher elo, but it IS something some players can say, which, in my opinion, counts as legitimate proof if they have the argument to back it up.
